Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

This opportunity is part of JPL’s Spacecraft Mechanical Engineering Section which creates innovative, technically excellent products in an inclusive team environment that offer creative and novel solutions for JPL’s boldest missions. Within this section, you would be part of the Entry, Descent, and Landing (EDL) and Formulation Group, which designs, builds, and tests the hardware and techniques that land our spacecraft on whatever planets we are going to. You will work with a team that leads the development of mission enabling technology and end-to-end mechanical systems for JPL projects and missions.

As a Mechanical Systems Engineer III, you will lead the selection and implementation of the Thermal Protection System (TPS) that protects our spacecraft from the intense heat it encounters upon entering the atmosphere. This role will involve quickly coming up to speed on TPS materials and performance characteristics, communicating with multi-disciplinary stakeholders, and leading the team towards the best solution. You will be a critical team member whose voice will be valued and heard as you work with a team of experienced engineers across NASA centers and industry.

In this role, you will:

  • Lead the selection and implementation of the thermal protection system for one or more critical JPL missions.

  • Dive into design details to ensure the material will meet its performance objectives.

  • Interact regularly with stakeholders to come up with the best solution.

  • Manage the TPS development schedule to ensure an on-time delivery to the customer.

  • Travel occasionally to support tests, team interactions, and reviews.

You must have:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or related technical discipline with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; Master’s degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 4 years of related experience; or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 2 years related experience. 

  • Extensive understanding and wide application of advanced principles, theories, concepts and techniques in solving mechanical engineering problems, performing trade studies, developing requirements, and identifying risks for spacecraft flight hardware.

  • Proven leadership skills and the ability to direct daily activities of a medium sized team.

  • Self-motivation and can work effectively both independently and within a multidisciplinary team structure.

  • Excellent communication (oral, written, presentation), interpersonal, and organizational skills.

Preferred skills:

  • Knowledge of thermal protection system materials.

  • Experience providing oversight to the fabrication, assembly, and qualification of spacecraft flight hardware.

  • Understanding of aerodynamics.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
